author: Staff Reporter
text:
College of Engineering Guindy (CEG) celebrated their 91st Alumni Day on Sunday.

Over 500 former students along with their families took part in the event.

Karunakaran, president of the alumni association, said they would support at least 25 start-ups from the campus.

The association will also construct a pond inside CEG to augment the water supply and save money for the management.

Four former students, N. Reguraj, T.S Vijayaraghavan, former IAS officer, N.S.Srinivasan and P.V Parthasarathy, were felicitated with distinguished alumnus awards.

On the occasion, 23 students received scholarships and 99 students were awarded medals.
title: CEG celebrates alumni day
